ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: CPCS: Boots (Broadmead) - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: The pharmacist will be expecting you today (or when they are next open). Please inform the pharmacist that you have been sent by NHS 111 Online. You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation: Referral Information: Provide the address and telephone number for the pharmacy and advise the patient the pharmacist will be expecting them (same day or when next open). Patient must inform pharmacist they have been referred by NHS 111.

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: CPCS: Redcliffe Pharmacy - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: 8 Waring House, Redcliff Hill, Bristol, BS1 6TB
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: The pharmacist will be expecting you today (or when they are next open). Please inform the pharmacist that you have been sent by NHS 111 Online. You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation: Referral Information: Provide the address and telephone number for the pharmacy and advise the patient the pharmacist will be expecting them (same day or when next open). Patient must inform pharmacist they have been referred by NHS 111.

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: GP - Broadmead Medical Centre - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: 59 Broadmead, Within Boots (First floor, The Galleries), BRISTOL, BS1 3ED
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation: Referral Information: This surgery is also open Monday to Friday between 18:30 and 20:00 and Saturday 09:00 till 13:00 for registered patients with a pre-arranged appointment.

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: GP - Bridge View Medical (Southville Surgery) - Bristol
UTC - Urgent Treatment Centre - BANES
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Foundation Trust, Combe Park, , Bath, BA1 3NG
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: This service operates 24 hours a day and is staffed by Nurse Practitioners, however there is also a GP available every day (Monday to Sunday) from 10:00 to Midnight.
Patients should be offered and booked an appointment by NHS111 within the disposition time frame using the electronic booking system.
If the electronic booking isnt available, the patient should be provided with the address and asked to make their own way to the UTC and present themselves at ED/UTC reception saying that they have an appointment or have been advised by NHS 111 to attend.
Patient Information will be transferred electronically to UTC. If the electronic transfer isnt available please tell the caller to make their own way to the UTC within the disposition time frame and then call them on 01225 824007 to pass the full call details over.
PLEASE DO NOT GIVE THE NUMBER OUT TO PATIENTS. HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS REQUIRING ACCESS TO THE SERVICE CAN BE PROVIDED WITH THIS NUMBER (01225 824007).

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: WIC - Broadmead Medical Centre - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: Broadmead Medical Centre, Within Boots (first floor, The Galleries), 59 Broadmead, Bristol, BS1 3EA
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: THIS IS A NURSE LED SERVICE. NO DOCTORS AVAILABLE TO SEE PATIENTS. THIS IS NOT AN APPOINTMENT SERVICE (there may be long waits at weekends and Bank Holidays)
We are not able to see PREGNANT women at this service. We are not able to take SWABS or SAMPLES at this service. Patients referred for wound care should attend with DRESSINGS and a CARE PLAN from their surgery
MONDAY - SATURDAY Sit & wait service only. LAST PATIENT ADMITTED 18:30
SUNDAY Sit &wait service only. LAST PATIENT ADMITTED 15:30
(helpful for advisors) when referring is to ask the patient if they can get here by last admission times as patients often attend 10 minutes before closing time.

ns1:serviceType.ns1:name: Integrated Urgent Care (IUC) Clinical Assessment Service (CAS)

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: CHOICE - GP - Montpelier Health Centre - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: This practice can register new patients who live outside their practice boundary area so you can register with a GP practice somewhere that's more convenient for you, such as a practice near your work. These arrangements are voluntary for GP practices. Please research your options in the area you want to register with and compare according to facilities, services or performance before you decide. Contact the practice and ask if it is accepting registrations from out-of-area patients. If the practice is accepting registrations, ask for a registration form. The practice will decide, following a review of your completed registration form, whether to accept you as a regular patient or accept you without home visiting duties. Because of the greater distance to your home, the GP you register with is under no obligation to offer you a home visit. If you are not well enough to go to the practice yourself, then other arrangements will be made.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: Only to be selected if the patient is at their home address and patient is registered with a GP practice out of their normal home area. Please ask caller to inform service on contact of GP Choice status.
This service is only available to patients resident in Bristol

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: CHOICE - GP - The Lennard Surgery - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: 1 Lewis Road, Bedminster Down, Bristol, BS13 7JD
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: This practice can register new patients who live outside their practice boundary area so you can register with a GP practice somewhere that's more convenient for you, such as a practice near your work. These arrangements are voluntary for GP practices. Please research your options in the area you want to register with and compare according to facilities, services or performance before you decide. Contact the practice and ask if it is accepting registrations from out-of-area patients. If the practice is accepting registrations, ask for a registration form. The practice will decide, following a review of your completed registration form, whether to accept you as a regular patient or accept you without home visiting duties. Because of the greater distance to your home, the GP you register with is under no obligation to offer you a home visit. ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: UCC - South Bristol Community Hospital - Bristol
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: Urgent Care Centre, South Bristol NHS Community Hospital, Hengrove Promenade, Bristol, BS14 0DB
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: *****Please tell patient to attend the Urgent Care Centre as soon as possible. Patients are seen in priority order and TOWARDS THE END OF THE DAY SOME PATIENTS MAY BE SIGN POSTED TO OTHER OPEN SERVICES.*****
PLEASE DO NOT REFER PATIENTS TO THIS SERVICE AFTER 20:00
PLEASE CALL BEFORE REFERRING PATIENTS TO UCC AFTER 18:00 TO SEE IF ANY RESTICTIONS ARE IN PLACE
THIS SERVICE CANNOT SEE PATIENTS UNDER 3 MONTHS OLD
This service provides X-Ray facilities for limb injuries from knee and collar bone down from age 2 upwards

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: MIU - Clevedon - North Somerset
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: North Somerset Community Hospital, Old Street, Clevedon, , BS21 6BS
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: This service does not see patients under 12 Months old.
X Ray open Monday - Friday 09.00 - 13.00 & 14.00 - 16.30 only
LAST PATIENT ADMITTED AT 20:30

ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:name: MIU - Paulton Minor Injuries Unit - BANES
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:address: Paulton Memorial Hospital, Salisbury Road, Paulton, Bristol, BS39 7SB
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:publicFacingInformation: You can go straight to this service. You do not need to telephone beforehand.
ns1:serviceCareSummaryDestination.ns1:referralInformation:
Referral Information: Please note that Paulton MIU is a nurse led unit. There are no GPs on site.
If you are unsure whether the patient is suitable for Paulton MIU please ring them to clarify. The number is as above, 01761 408 114
Please note, last patient entry is at 21.15.
X Ray is open Monday - Friday 0900 - 1600. Plain film only. Cannot X Ray: patients under 2 years old, hips, skulls, spines, necks or chests
